required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Optimys Femoral Stem for Total Hip Replacement
clinical_study.official_title: Optimys Femoral Stem for Total Hip Replacement - a Clinical and Radiologic Follow-up of Minimum One Year

brief_summary.textblock: This retrospective observational study analyses the surgical performance, clinical and radiologic outcome as well as the rate of infections with a main focus on revision surgeries after primary implantation of the Optimys short stem femoral prosthesis.

primary_outcome.time_frame: one year follow-up period after Optimys femoral stem surgery
primary_outcome.description: rate of reoperations after primary implantation of the Optimys short stem prosthesis

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at one year follow-up after Optimys femoral stem surgery
one year follow-up period after Optimys femoral stem surgery
secondary_outcome.description: rate of fractures after the implantation of short stem femoral implants

secondary_outcome.time_frame: one year follow-up period after Optimys femoral stem surgery
secondary_outcome.description: rate of infections after the implantation of short stem femoral implants

secondary_outcome.measure: anatomic alignment on anterior-posterior (ap) view in DegreeÂ°
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at one year follow-up after Optimys femoral stem surgery
secondary_outcome.description: radiologic outcome defined by preciseness of the anatomic alignment compared to the contralateral side

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at one year follow-up after Optimys femoral stem surgery
secondary_outcome.description: radiologic outcome defined by rate of subsidence after the implantation of short stem femoral implants (mm)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at one year follow-up after Optimys femoral stem surgery
secondary_outcome.description: clinical outcome defined by pain at rest (yes/no)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at one year follow-up after Optimys femoral stem surgery
secondary_outcome.description: clinical outcome defined by pain under stress (yes/no)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at one year follow-up after Optimys femoral stem surgery
secondary_outcome.description: clinical outcome defined by use of analgetics (yes/no)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at one year follow-up after Optimys femoral stem surgery
secondary_outcome.description: clinical outcome defined by use of walking aids

secondary_outcome.measure: extent of periarticular ossification (PAO) according to Brooker classification system
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at one year follow-up after Optimys femoral stem surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Brooker classification system divides severity of PAO into 4 types: A: islands of bone within the soft tissues about the hip B: bone spurs originating from the pelvis or proximal end of the femur, leaving at least 1 cm between opposing bone surfaces C: bone spurs originating from the pelvis or proximal end of the femur, reducing the space between opposing bone surfaces to less than 1 cm D: bone ankylosis of the hip

intervention.intervention_name: retrospective analysis of surgical performance, clinical and radiologic outcome
intervention.description: retrospective analysis of surgical performance, clinical and radiologic outcome

study_pop.textblock: Patients treated for a proximal femoral fracture at the University Hospital Basel between 29.10.2013 (date of introduction of the Optimys femoral component at the university hospital Basel) and 29.10.2018.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients treated with an Optimys femoral component at the University Hospital Basel between 29.10.2013 and 29.10.2018
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinical follow up at another Institution
- Documented dissent in study participation

facility.name: Department of Orthopaedics and Trauma Surgery (DOTS).
